tool.name: IDFileConverter
tool.command:
IDFileConverter
#if $param_in: -in $param_in #end if #if $param_out: -out $param_out #end if #if $param_out_type: -out_type #if " " in str($param_out_type): "$param_out_type" #else $param_out_type #end if #end if #if $param_mz_file: -mz_file $param_mz_file #end if #if $param_mz_name: -mz_name "$param_mz_name" #end if #if $param_peptideprophet_analyzed: -peptideprophet_analyzed #end if #if $param_score_type: -score_type $param_score_type #end if #if $adv_opts.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts.param_ignore_proteins_per_peptide: -ignore_proteins_per_peptide #end if #if $adv_opts.param_scan_regex: -scan_regex "$adv_opts.param_scan_regex" #end if #if $adv_opts.param_force: -force #end if #end if

param.name: param_in
param.label: Input file or directory containing the data to convert
param.help:
(-in) This may be:
- a single file in a multi-purpose XML format (pepXML, protXML, idXML, mzid),
- a single file in a search engine-specific format (Mascot: mascotXML, OMSSA: omssaXML, X! Tandem: xml, Percolator: psms),
- a single text file (tab separated) with one line for all peptide sequences matching a spectrum (top N hits),
- for Sequest results, a directory containing .out files.

param.name: param_out_type
param.label: Output file type (default: determined from file extension)

param.name: param_mz_file
param.label: [pepXML, Sequest, Mascot, X! Tandem, Percolator only] Retention times will be looked up in this file

param.name: param_mz_name
param.label: [pepXML only] Experiment filename/path (extension will be removed) to match in the pepXML file ('base_name' attribute)

param.name: param_peptideprophet_analyzed
param.label: [pepXML output only] Write output in the format of a PeptideProphet analysis result
param.help: (-peptideprophet_analyzed) By default a 'raw' pepXML is produced that contains only search engine results

param.name: param_score_type
param.label: [Percolator only] Which of the Percolator scores to report as 'the' score for a peptide hit

param.name: param_ignore_proteins_per_peptide
param.label: [Sequest only] Workaround to deal with .out files that contain
param.help:
(-ignore_proteins_per_peptide) e.g. "+1" in references column,
but do not list extra references in subsequent lines (try -debug 3 or 4)

param.name: param_scan_regex
param.label: [Mascot, pepXML, Percolator only] Regular expression used to extract the scan number or retention time

tool.help:
Converts identification engine file formats.
For more information, visit http://ftp.mi.fu-berlin.de/OpenMS/release-documentation/html/TOPP_IDFileConverter.html
